result.markdown:
# New columns Adding new columns to a data frame is pretty straight forward. We just define the column name, and then assign it some input: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} persons <- data.frame(name = c("Anna", "Alex", "John", "Jessi"), age = c(19, 17, 18, 18), birth_month = c("Jan", "Sep", "Oct", "Mar"), big5_extro = c(3.5, 2, 4.5, 4.2) ) persons$big5_neuro <- c(3, 4, 1, 2) ``` ::: Or, using the `tidyverse`:
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) persons <- persons %>% mutate(big5_open = c(3, 4, 3, 4)) ``` :::
# ifelse We can also add new values conditionally, for example by using the `ifelse()` function: ::: {.cell} ::: # missings
